translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The order of the ideas, the reverse order, the triplets, the dukes, the Paṭṭhāna text

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.38. Hīnattika, Hetuduka🔽Hīnaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahīno nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā terasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke aṭṭha …pe… avigate terasa.
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  hīnattika hetuduka  hīnam hetum dhammam paṭicca na hīnaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā terasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke aṭṭha pe avigate terasa

original: Hīnaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca namajjhimo nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā nava …pe… vipāke cha …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hīnam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na majjhimaḥ na na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā nava pe vipāke cha pe avigate nava
translated: With an inferior idea having a cause as its ground there arises an inferior idea not having a cause as its ground, with a cause as condition. (In brief.)
